definition: to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
light/ray/CL:道[dao4]/bright/only/merely/to use up
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

sentences.english: We are to push traditional Chinese medicine to the world and carry forward to a higher level of development.
sentences.chinese: 健心人要把中药推向世界，将其发扬光大。

sentences.english: People in Hongkong are fond of making soup.
sentences.chinese: 香港是广东“汤文化”的发扬光大者。

sentences.english: So we have sufficient reason to carry forward and further develop it in perpetuity.
sentences.chinese: 我们有理由永远把它继承并发扬光大。

sentences.english: Democracy will one day prosper in the country.
sentences.chinese: 民主终有一天会在这个国家发扬光大。

sentences.english: Therefore, I firmly believe that Guqin will enjoy a bright future of development.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信古琴的发展趋势必然是能够发扬光大的。

sentences.english: Can make the Confucianism thoroughfare thought reserve and promote.
sentences.chinese: 使儒家孔孟思想得以保留并且发扬光大。

sentences.english: Traditionally girly styles are made even more feminine with theaddition of this fun print.
sentences.chinese: 这些趣味十足的印花将传统的柔美风格发扬光大。

sentences.english: Bob: Yeah, we should emulate the spirit of Lei Feng.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我们应该把雷锋精神发扬光大。

sentences.english: So you are better off getting someone quick and you develop him with experience.
sentences.chinese: 所以你最好找个快手然后用经验让他发扬光大。

definition: to develop/to make full use of
to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to have qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
to enhance/to promote/to enrich
to inherit/to succeed to (the throne etc)/to carry on (a tradition etc)
to initiate/to start/to found
lit. the color blue is made out of indigo but is more vivid than indigo (idiom)/fig. the student surpasses the master
pinyin: qing1 chu1 yu2 lan2 er2 sheng4 yu2 lan2

definition: passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
marrow/pith/quintessence/essence
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
to teach/to impart/a disciple/descendant
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
to take up sb's mantle/to follow in sb's steps
variant of 弘揚|弘扬[hong2 yang2]
